title: How were jewish refugees treated in the second world war? - Quora

response.answer_text: Taken to Israel not to have to deal with them in the ally countries.  In the cases where Jews were allowed to go to UK or USA they could only live in particular cities and neighbourhoods of these countries as to not disrupt particular areas with the sudden change that comes with thousands of persons suddenly moving in around the locals. I personally know many Jews from Uruguay and Argentina (where I'm from) who were also taken in as refugees during ww2 who made it a life quest to make it to Israel and help anyone else they know to do the same.
